intro: Gonolobus diadematus, commonly known as the golden crown vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its climbing habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often resembling a crown, hence its common name. It thrives in humid environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. The seeds are enclosed in hairy pods and can be dispersed by wind or animals.
